how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Part dry hair..-Apply a few drops for fine hair, one full dropper for thick hair. The details: In the past, I used the Briogeo Scalp Revival Charcoal + Tea Tree Scalp Treatment Serum and loved it. I didn't use it as part of a regular routine, but I would put it on any time my scalp felt itchy or dry. Sometimes that was just one or two spots, sometimes it was my whole scalp, but it always worked wonderfully to soothe the itch immediately. When that bottle finally ran out, I decided to try the Fable & Mane serum just to try something new.  The F&M serum definitely did NOT provide the amount of itch relief that the Briogeo serum did... honestly, I didn't feel like it provided much itch relief at all. I used it as a tiny spot treatment one night and it didn't do anything other than make my hair kinda oily in that spot.  A few nights later, again with an itchy scalp, I decided to try it the way you're supposed to, by putting it all over my scalp. I used one dropper full, and maybe a few extra drops. I left it on overnight, and the next morning when I washed my hair, it came out in ***huge fistfuls***.   Needless to say, I haven't used the serum again, but the shedding hasn't stopped, and it isn't limited to the shower - I'm constantly picking hair off my clothes, desk, food, and I fill my hairbrush every time I brush. The pic is just what came out in the shower on my hands a week later.   I'm now desperately hunting something to curb the shedding, but I'm also traumatized and afraid that anything I try might make it worse. I have long, fine hair but a lot of it - there doesn't seem to be a visible difference in my hair yet, but I've filled a small bathroom trash can with hair over the last two weeks.   My ten cents? Just use the Briogeo one!

On their website it says, “We recommend that this serum be used on the scalp only” when someone asked if you could use it on the ends. There is a video on YouTube from Fable & Mane that shows how to apply the serum. In the video it shows them putting 1 initial dropperful in the model’s hair. Then she uses 3 more dropperful’s in her hair and says, “You can never use too much, this is literal magic”. She even says “Don’t forget to cover your scalp all the way to the ends”. I did notice that it said this was for “deeper conditioning” but the different instructions are confusing to me. Do you just put it on your scalp only? Do you use it throughout your hair? One dropperful or 4 dropperful’s?  I’m just going to do what works best for my particular hair type. I do recommend this if you have an itchy scalp and dry hair. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Just started using this serum last month and I love it! I love how the fragrance is softer  (it reminds me of Hermes because it’s musky scent). reviews.review_text: I’ve absolutely fallen in love with this serum! It has a lightweight texture that absorbs into the scalp instantly! My scalp is pretty dry and is often quite itchy. The serum is very soothing and calming! The scent is not overpowering at all! I highly recommend it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve tried other scalp soothing products before, but have yet to find something that actually made a noticeable difference without leaving a greasy film in my hair. The first time I used this serum I was honestly blown away. I followed the instructions for best use by massaging the oil into my dry hair before bed, then washed my hair like usual the next morning. Not only did my irritated scalp feel sooo much better, but I felt like my hair was truly clean. Like post-salon clean. It also doesn’t leave my hair greasy at all, which is a serious win for the fine hair crew like me.  I’ve been using this serum weekly since it first launched almost a month ago and I honestly look forward to using it each time. I have a feeling I’m definitely going to be reaching for this even more now that we’re starting to head into cold weather.

reviews.review_text: Love incorporating scalp-care products in my routine and this has been such a treat to use! I love the lightweight, watery consistency with a bit of oily slip to it. Doesn't feel oily on my scalp though, and love the beautiful soothing sandalwood smell! I've been using it bi-weekly as instructed and it leaves my hair softer and shinier and my scalp less itchy and more balanced. For best results I love using it overnight before wash-day!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I can’t believe how much I love this serum! It smells so good and makes my hair shiny and soft! I love that it’s cruelty free too! Because it’s so thin and lightweight it absorbs nicely an doesn’t make me look oily. Tempted to use it on my whole body because I love the scent!

reviews.review_buyer_description: brown hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This has really been a lifesaver for me this summer! My scalp gets super dry from the beach and pool and using this after a beach trip has saved my scalp. It has a super nice earthy scent that I enjoy too. To see the best resultsI like leaving this in overnight!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is a really beautiful hair serum! It smells just like lavender and rosemary and is very relaxing. It has helped soothe my itchy scalp and increased hydration. It has a lightweight oil like consistency. I use it a couple hours before washing my hair. The serum absorbs nicely and doesn’t just sit on the scalp it stuck in the hair strands. I’ve already noticed a healthier scalp and shiny hair!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Honestly I completely love the smell of sandalwood thats one of my fave things about this product. I'm very impressed about this product because normally most serums are very oily and this one is perfect. It has the perfect balance with all the amazing ingredients.

reviews.review_text: Honestly you can’t get beyond the sandalwood earthy smell of this oil.  I’m sure it’s very good for your skin but after I put it on my hair, I immediately wanted to wash it off.  The smell is overpowering and kind of gives you a headache.  If you don’t mind incense infused aromas, you will probably like this.

reviews.review_text: I love love this scalp soothing serum! SUPER nice! Definitely try it out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This serum has been wonderful to use for destressing due to the lavender scent. I think this serum works best for anyone who showers in the morning because it can help with sleep and can be left overnight. I keep the serum in about 1-2 hours before taking my evening shower, but I end up with such shiny locks! However, I can't vouch for the dryness or itchiness claims, just because I haven't had those problems in awhile!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love applying this serum at night as I get a chance to take my time and fully massage it into my scalp and let the serum do its magic ovenight. Plus the scent is very relaxing, it is the perfect scent to smell before heading to bed.  I have a dry and itchy scalp but this seum has been a huge help. If you are looking for a scalp serum do give this one a try!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I use styling products on my short hair, struggling with build up and itchiness sometimes. This serum works beautifully, it not only soothes my scalp, but also adds shine to my hair.  The formula is truly elegant, so this oil is lightweight. It’s one of the few products I keep in it’s original packaging. It has become a ritual for me to open the box, read the beautiful message inside of it, rub one full dropper of oil between my palms, inhale it’s gorgeous calming smell, and massage into scalp. I leave it overnight and wash my hair in the morning.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The new Amla Soothing Scalp Serum is the perfect addition to my haircare routine. It has a pleasant herbal scent and the formula is non-greasy. I felt a gentle soothing effect which is welcome in the summer heat! After rinsing, my hair and scalp felt hydrated and my hair was soft, shiny and so easy to style the next day. I’m utterly obsessed!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wasn’t sure what to expect with an oil serum for my hair but wow this blew my mind. I struggle with scalp issues and buildup and initially thought an oil serum wouldn’t help but it actually absorbed so well into my scalp and hair, felt less oily over time and help break up some of that build up. It had a calming smell and makes me want to massage my head, which is really nice. I’m a fan!

reviews.review_title: Another home run by Fable & Mane!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have been following Fable & Mane since their shampoo launched and I have tried all their products and have loved them immensely. This was no exception. I absolutely love the smell, I love the soothing feel when I applied it to my scalp and I love how soft and smooth it made my hair feel after I washed it. I left it in overnight which I normally don’t do with hair products because I find it so messy but this was so easy to leave on and the smell kept giving me soothing vibes. I absolutely love this product and I can’t wait to incorporate it into my nighttime routine going forward.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I really enjoy this scalp treatment serum alot. Love the pleasant scent and it's not leave oily/greasy on my hair & scalp. So far, it helps my scalp less itchy and dry.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This has been such a treat to use. It has a runny consistency that isn’t heavy or sticky. It smells lavender-y with a minty undertone—veeery calming and pleasant like the scent of a yoga room. The effects of the Indian plants, amla and bakuchi, in this serum is almost immediate. I use dry shampoos and oils A LOT, but even only using the serum twice has made my scalp feel less congested and itchy from product buildup. I feel like I’ve been shedding less hair too since my scalp is slowly becoming more habitable! It is recommended that I use it bi-weekly, but I’m not sure I can hold back from using it more than that.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: My hair type is 3B curls and they tend to be very dry! This serum is not only extremely light weight but it soothes my scalp and hydrated my extra dry damaged ends. It smells amazing and doesn’t weight down my curls like many other serums. I plan on using this bi weekly as a treatment and can’t wait to see the results!

reviews.review_text: Absolutely love this hair serum ! I have very dry hair and this serum has absolutely been a game changer ! It’s so lightweight but also very nourishing and soothing ! I wear protective styles very often and this is the perfect product because it’s so easy to use and takes no hassle. Smells absolutely amazing! I can already tell this is going to be a staple in my haircare collection !
